foreignNames.name: 自由なる者ルーリク・サー

cards.name: Ruric Thar, the Unbowed
cards.originalText:
Vigilance, reach
Ruric Thar, the Unbowed attacks each combat if able.
Whenever a player casts a noncreature spell, Ruric Thar deals 6 damage to that player.

rulings.text: Ruric Thar's triggered ability triggers whenever any player casts a noncreature spell, including you.
Ruric Thar's triggered ability resolves before the spell that caused it to trigger. The ability will resolve even if that spell is countered.

If Ruric Thar can't attack for any reason (such as being tapped or having come under that player's control that turn), then it doesn't attack. If there's a cost associated with having a creature attack, the player isn't forced to pay that cost, so Ruric Thar doesn't have to attack in that case either.

cards.text:
Vigilance, reach
Ruric Thar, the Unbowed attacks each combat if able.
Whenever a player casts a noncreature spell, Ruric Thar deals 6 damage to that player.

cards.name: Skarrgan Firebird
cards.originalText: Bloodthirst 3 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it.) Flying {R}{R}{R}: Return Skarrgan Firebird from your graveyard to your hand. Activate this ability only if an opponent was dealt damage this turn.

rulings.text: You can activate Skarrgan Firebird's last ability if an opponent was dealt damage by any source, even if you didn't control that source.

cards.text:

{R}{R}{R}: Return Skarrgan Firebird from your graveyard to your hand. Activate this ability only if an opponent was dealt damage this turn.

cards.flavor: Long ago, birds of paradise littered the skies. Thanks to the city's sprawl, most now exist as pets of society's elite.
cards.name: Birds of Paradise
cards.originalText:
Flying
{T}: Add one mana of any color.
cards.text:
Flying
{T}: Add one mana of any color.

cards.name: Protean Hulk
cards.originalText: When Protean Hulk dies, search your library for any number of creature cards with total converted mana cost 6 or less and put them onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: If a card in your library has {X} in its mana cost, X is considered to be 0.

You can find any number of creature cards, so long as their total converted mana cost is 6 or less. For example, you could find eight creature cards with converted mana cost 0 and three with converted mana cost 2, but you couldn't find two with converted mana cost 4.

cards.text: When Protean Hulk dies, search your library for any number of creature cards with total converted mana cost 6 or less and put them onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Skarrgan Pit-Skulk
cards.originalText: Bloodthirst 1 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it.) Creatures with power less than Skarrgan Pit-Skulk's power can't block it.

rulings.text: Skarrgan Pit-Skulk compares each blocker's power against its own as blockers are being declared.

cards.text:
Bloodthirst 1 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it.)
Creatures with power less than Skarrgan Pit-Skulk's power can't block it.

cards.flavor:
"The Gruul embrace all things poisonous and living in the cracks of society."
—Teysa Karlov
cards.name: Wasteland Viper
cards.originalText: Deathtouch Bloodrush — {G}, Discard Wasteland Viper: Target attacking creature gets +1/+2 and gains deathtouch until end of turn.
cards.text:
Deathtouch
Bloodrush — {G}, Discard Wasteland Viper: Target attacking creature gets +1/+2 and gains deathtouch until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Some use magic to spy through walls. Others use it to crush them.
cards.name: Wurmweaver Coil
cards.originalText:
Enchant green creature
Enchanted creature gets +6/+6.
{G}{G}{G}, Sacrifice Wurmweaver Coil: Create a 6/6 green Wurm creature token.

rulings.text: Wurmweaver Coil can enchant only a green creature. It can't enter the battlefield attached to a nongreen creature, it can't be moved onto a nongreen creature, and if the creature it's attached to stops being green, the Aura is put into its owner's graveyard.

cards.text:
Enchant green creature
Enchanted creature gets +6/+6.
{G}{G}{G}, Sacrifice Wurmweaver Coil: Create a 6/6 green Wurm creature token.

cards.flavor:
"It's easy to see why those Gruul dirtbags follow him—the only orders he gives are 'Crush them!' and 'We eat!'"
—Teysa Karlov
cards.name: Borborygmos
cards.originalText:
Trample
Whenever Borborygmos deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control.

rulings.text: Borborygmos's ability won't save your creatures that were dealt lethal damage in combat. Those creatures will be sent to your graveyard before they would get a counter.

cards.text:
Trample
Whenever Borborygmos deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control.

cards.flavor: Those who regard the Gruul as savage simpletons underestimate the subtle power of their shamans.
cards.name: Burning-Tree Emissary
cards.originalText: When Burning-Tree Emissary enters the battlefield, add {R}{G}.

rulings.text: Burning-Tree Emissary's ability isn't a mana ability. It uses the stack and can be responded to.

cards.text: When Burning-Tree Emissary enters the battlefield, add {R}{G}.

cards.flavor: Gruul shamans are bent on punishing the civilized. Any act more complex than rubbing sticks together or eating with utensils is met with the stinging burn of their magic.
cards.name: Burning-Tree Shaman
cards.originalText: Whenever a player activates an ability that isn't a mana ability, Burning-Tree Shaman deals 1 damage to that player.

rulings.text: A mana ability is an ability that adds mana to your mana pool, not one that costs mana to activate.
A mana ability is an ability that (1) isn't a loyalty ability, (2) doesn't target, and (3) could put mana into a player's mana pool when it resolves.

cards.text: Whenever a player activates an ability that isn't a mana ability, Burning-Tree Shaman deals 1 damage to that player.

cards.flavor:
"The Simic come from the cold slow depths. How could they understand the fire in a wild heart?"
—Kroshkar, Gruul shaman
cards.name: Ghor-Clan Rampager
cards.originalText: Trample Bloodrush — {R}{G}, Discard Ghor-Clan Rampager: Target attacking creature gets +4/+4 and gains trample until end of turn.
cards.text:
Trample
Bloodrush — {R}{G}, Discard Ghor-Clan Rampager: Target attacking creature gets +4/+4 and gains trample until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"We respect all lifeforms, but this one we respect from a distance."
—Mandor, Selesnya ranger
cards.name: Giant Solifuge
cards.originalText: Trample, haste Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
cards.text:
({R/G} can be paid with either {R} or {G}.)
Trample; haste; shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

cards.name: Gruul Charm
cards.originalText:
Choose one —
• Creatures without flying can't block this turn.
• Gain control of all permanents you own.
• Gruul Charm deals 3 damage to each creature with flying.

rulings.text: If you choose the first mode, no creature without flying will be able to block that turn, including creatures that lose flying and creatures without flying that enter the battlefield after Gruul Charm resolves.
If you choose the second mode, Gruul Charm's effect will override any other control-changing effects on those permanents.
A token is owned by the player under whose control it entered the battlefield.

cards.text:
Choose one —
• Creatures without flying can't block this turn.
• Gain control of all permanents you own.
• Gruul Charm deals 3 damage to each creature with flying.

cards.flavor:
"All the coins in Ravnica can't save his soul now."
—Narbulg Nine Fingers
cards.name: Pit Fight
cards.originalText: Target creature you control fights another target creature. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)

rulings.text: The second target of Pit Fight can be another creature you control, but it can't be the same creature as the first target.
If either target of Pit Fight is an illegal target when the ability tries to resolve, neither creature will deal or be dealt damage.

cards.text: Target creature you control fights another target creature. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)

cards.flavor:
"This city will perish, and the Gruul will cheer as the boar-god crushes the last bricks into dust."
—Nikya of the Old Ways
cards.name: Rubblebelt Raiders
cards.originalText: Whenever Rubblebelt Raiders attacks, put a +1/+1 counter on it for each attacking creature you control.

rulings.text: Count the number of attacking creatures you control when Rubblebelt Raiders's ability resolves, including Rubblebelt Raiders itself, to determine how many +1/+1 counters to put on it.

cards.text: Whenever Rubblebelt Raiders attacks, put a +1/+1 counter on it for each attacking creature you control.

cards.name: Rubblehulk
cards.originalText: Rubblehulk's power and toughness are each equal to the number of lands you control. Bloodrush — {1}{R}{G}, Discard Rubblehulk: Target attacking creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of lands you control.

rulings.text: The ability that defines Rubblehulk's power and toughness works in all zones, not just the battlefield.
If you activate Rubblehulk's bloodrush ability, the value of X is the number of lands you control when that ability resolves.

cards.text:
Rubblehulk's power and toughness are each equal to the number of lands you control.
Bloodrush — {1}{R}{G}, Discard Rubblehulk: Target attacking creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of lands you control.

cards.flavor: The Orzhov contract the Izzet to animate slum districts and banish them to the wastes. The Gruul adopt them and send them back to the city for vengeance.
cards.name: Rumbling Slum
cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, Rumbling Slum deals 1 damage to each player.
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, Rumbling Slum deals 1 damage to each player.

cards.flavor:
"Nature is the ultimate mindless destroyer, capable of power and ferocity no army can match, and the Gruul follow its example."
—Trigori, Azorius senator

cards.name: Ulasht, the Hate Seed
cards.originalText:
Ulasht, the Hate Seed enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it for each other red creature you control and a +1/+1 counter on it for each other green creature you control.
{1}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Ulasht: Choose one —
• Ulasht deals 1 damage to target creature.
• Create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token.

rulings.text: Creatures that are both red and green provide two +1/+1 counters.

cards.flavor: "Only the decadent think magic should be pristine and without cost."
cards.name: Zhur-Taa Druid
cards.originalText:
{T}: Add {G}.
Whenever you tap Zhur-Taa Druid for mana, it deals 1 damage to each opponent.

rulings.text: Zhur-Taa Druid's last ability doesn't trigger if it becomes tapped for any other reason. However, if Zhur-Taa Druid gains another mana ability that requires you tap it, its ability will trigger.
If you tap Zhur-Taa Druid for mana during the process of casting a spell or activating an ability, its triggered ability will resolve before that spell or ability.
Zhur-Taa Druid's last ability isn't a mana ability. It uses the stack and can be responded to.

cards.text:
{T}: Add {G}.
Whenever you tap Zhur-Taa Druid for mana, it deals 1 damage to each opponent.

cards.flavor: Gurley was the first to domesticate one, though his widow didn't take much solace in that accomplishment.

cards.originalText: Bloodrush — {1}{R}{G}, Discard Zhur-Taa Swine: Target attacking creature gets +5/+4 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Gruul territorial markings need not be legible. The blood, snot, and muck used to smear them are unmistakably Gruul.

rulings.text: If this land enters the battlefield and you control no other lands, its ability will force you to return it to your hand.
